nodes.text: Victor Entertainment, Inc. (ビクターエンタテインメント株式会社 Bikutā Entateinmento Kabushiki-gaisha) was a subsidiary of electronics company JVC that published some Star Wars video games. It was founded as Victor Music Industries, Inc. (ビクター音楽産業株式会社, Bikutā Ongaku Sangyō Kabushiki-gaisha), but it later changed its name to Victor Entertainment in April 1993. Its American and PAL region subsidiaries were named JVC Musical Industries, Inc.
Victor Entertainment's video game operations were spun-off into a different division of JVC on October 1, 1996.
